member.param: The text factory. if this argument is null the must be used during the analysis.

member.name: P:SharpNL.Analyzer.IAnalyzer.Weight
member.summary: Property used to control the influence of a analyzer during the execution in the . The lower values will be executed first.
member.value: Returns a floating point value indicating the relative weight a task.
member.remarks:
The standard weights are:
WeightAnalyzer
0.0Sentence detection.
1.0Tokenization.
2.0Document categorizer.
3.0Entity recognition.
4.0Part-Of-Speech tagging.
5.0Chunking
6.0Parsing

member.param: The text factory. if this argument is null the must be used during the analysis.

member.name: P:SharpNL.Lemmatizer.LemmatizerAnalyzer.Weight
member.summary: Property used to control the influence of a analyzer during the execution in the . The lower values will be executed first.
member.value: Returns a floating point value indicating the relative weight a task.
member.remarks:
The standard weights are:
WeightAnalyzer
0.0Sentence detection.
1.0Tokenization.
2.0Document categorizer.
3.0Entity recognition.
4.0Part-Of-Speech tagging.
5.0Chunking
6.0Parsing

member.name: T:SharpNL.Utility.FeatureGen.IAdaptiveFeatureGenerator
member.summary: An interface for generating features for name entity identification and for updating document level contexts.
member.remarks:
Most implementors do not need the adaptive functionality of this interface, they should extend the class instead.
Feature generation is not thread safe and a instance of a feature generator must only be called from one thread. The resources used by a feature generator are typically shared between man instances of features generators which are called from many threads and have to be thread safe.

The outcomes for the tokens prior to the specified index.

member.name: T:SharpNL.Formats.Ad.AdContractionNameSampleStream
member.summary:
Parser for Floresta Sita(c)tica Arvores Deitadas corpus, output to for the Portuguese NER training.
The data contains common multi word expressions. The categories are:
intj, spec, conj-s, num, pron-indef, n, prop, adj, prp, adv

remarks.para: Data can be found on this web site:

Information about the format:
"rvores deitadas: Descrio do formato e das opes de anlise na Floresta Sintctica"
Detailed info about the NER tagset:

member.name: T:SharpNL.Formats.Ad.PortugueseContractionUtility
member.summary: Utility class to handle Portuguese contractions.
member.remarks: Some Corpora splits contractions in its parts, for example, "da" > "de" + "a", but according to the phase of language processing, NER for instance, we can't decide if to split a contraction or not, specially because contractions inside names are not separated, but outside are.

member.returns: The merged contraction.

member.summary: Expands the specified contraction into its components.
member.returns: The expanded contraction or null if the contraction cannot be found.

member.summary: Serializes the model to the given filename. If the specified file already exist, the serializer will overwrite the existing file.

The specified path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.

The specified path, file name, or both exceed the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.

member.name: T:SharpNL.DocumentCategorizer.DocumentSampleStream
member.summary: This class reads in string encoded training samples, parses them and outputs objects.
member.remarks:
Format:
Each line contains one sample document.
The category is the first string in the line followed by a tab and whitespace separated document tokens.
Sample line: category-string tab-char whitespace-separated-tokens line-break-char(s)

member.summary: Parses the specified sentence string. Converts the string representation of a sentence in a specified attributes and culture-specific format to its equivalent. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed.
member.param: if set to true the invalid sentences will be ignored.

member.summary: Converts the specified string representation of a tree element to its equivalent and returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the value equivalent to the element contained in , if the conversion succeeded, or null if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the parameter is null, is an empty string (""), or does not contain a valid string representation of a AdElement. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
The string representation of the element.
if set to true the invalid sentences will be ignored.
member.returns: true if the s parameter was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:SharpNL.Formats.CoNLL02NameSampleStream
member.summary:
Parser for the dutch and spanish ner training files of the CONLL 2002 shared task.
The dutch data has a -DOCSTART- tag to mark article boundaries, adaptive data in the feature generators will be cleared before every article.
The spanish data does not contain article boundaries, adaptive data will be cleared for every sentence.
The data contains four named entity types: Person, Organization, Location and Misc.
member.remarks: Data can be found on this web site:

member.name: M:SharpNL.ML.Model.AbstractModel.GetDataStructures
member.summary:
Provides the fundamental data structures which encode the maxent model information. This method will usually only be needed by GISModelWriters. The following values are held in the Object array which is returned by this method:
index 0: containing the model parameters. index 1: containing the mapping of model predicates to unique integers. index 2: containing the names of the outcomes, stored in the index of the array which represents their unique ids in the model. index 3: containing the value of the models correction constant. index 4: containing the value of the models correction parameter.
member.returns: System.Object[].

member.name: T:SharpNL.ML.MaxEntropy.GISTrainer
member.summary: An implementation of Generalized Iterative Scaling.
member.remarks:
The reference paper for this implementation was Adwait Ratnaparkhi's tech report at the University of Pennsylvania's Institute for Research in Cognitive Science, and is available at .
The slack parameter used in the above implementation has been removed by default from the computation and a method for updating with Gaussian smoothing has been added per Investigating GIS and Smoothing for Maximum Entropy Taggers, Clark and Curran (2002).
A prior can be used to train models which converge to the distribution which minimizes the relative entropy between the distribution specified by the empirical constraints of the training data and the specified prior. By default, the uniform distribution is used as the prior.

member.name: F:SharpNL.ML.MaxEntropy.GISTrainer.useGaussianSmoothing
member.summary: Specified whether parameter updates should prefer a distribution of parameters which is gaussian.

member.name: T:SharpNL.ML.Model.IndexHashTable`1
member.summary: The is a hash table which maps entries of an array to their index in the array. All entries in the array must be unique otherwise a well-defined mapping is not possible.
member.remarks: The entry objects must implement and otherwise the behavior of this class is undefined. The implementation uses a hash table with open addressing and linear probing. The table is thread safe and can concurrently accessed by multiple threads, thread safety is achieved through immutability. Though its not strictly immutable which means, that the table must still be safely published to other threads.

member.name: M:SharpNL.ML.Model.IndexHashTable`1.#ctor(`0[],System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. The specified array is copied into the table and later changes to the array do not affect this table in any way.
member.param: The values to be indexed, all values must be unique otherwise a well-defined mapping of an entry to an index is not possible.
member.exception: @The load factor must be larger than 0 and equal to or smaller than 1.;loadFactor
Array must contain only unique keys!

member.summary: Gets the hash table size.

member.returns: The index or -1 if there is no entry to the keys.

member.name: T:SharpNL.ML.Model.TwoPassDataIndexer
member.summary: Collecting event and context counts by making two passes over the events. The first pass determines which contexts will be used by the model, and the second pass creates the events in memory containing only the contexts which will be used. This greatly reduces the amount of memory required for storing the events. During the first pass a temporary event file is created which is read during the second pass.

member.name: T:SharpNL.ML.Perceptron.IO.SuffixSensitivePerceptronModelWriter
member.summary: A writer for perceptron models which inspects the filename and invokes the appropriate depending on the filename's suffixes.

remarks.para:
The following assumption are made about suffixes:
.gz - file is GZipped (must be last suffix) .bin - file is binary .txt - file is plain text (default)

member.name: T:SharpNL.ML.Perceptron.PerceptronTrainer
member.summary: Trains models using the perceptron algorithm.
member.remarks:
Each outcome is represented as a binary perceptron classifier. This supports standard (integer) weighting as well average weighting as described in:
Discriminative Training Methods for Hidden Markov Models: Theory and Experiments with the Perceptron Algorithm. Michael Collins, EMNLP 2002.

member.summary: Gets or sets the tolerance. If the change in training set accuracy is less than this, stop iterating.

member.name: P:SharpNL.ML.Perceptron.PerceptronTrainer.UseSkippedAveraging
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether skipped averaging is enabled.
member.value: true if skipped averaging is enabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
If we are doing averaging, and the current iteration is one of the first 20 or it is a perfect square, then updated the summed parameters.
The reason we don't take all of them is that the parameters change less toward the end of training, so they drown out the contributions of the more volatile early iterations. The use of perfect squares allows us to sample from successively farther apart iterations.

member.name: T:SharpNL.ML.Perceptron.SimplePerceptronSequenceTrainer
member.summary: Trains models for sequences using the perceptron algorithm.
member.remarks: Each outcome is represented as a binary perceptron classifier. This supports standard (integer) weighting as well average weighting. Sequence information is used in a simplified was to that described in: Discriminative Training Methods for Hidden Markov Models: Theory and Experiments with the Perceptron Algorithm. Michael Collins, EMNLP 2002. Specifically only updates are applied to tokens which were incorrectly tagged by a sequence tagger rather than to all feature across the sequence which differ from the training sequence.

members.member: Number of events in the event set.
List of outcomes for each event i, in context[i].
Stores the estimated parameter value of each predicate during iteration.

member.name: T:SharpNL.Parser.AbstractBottomUpParser
member.summary: Abstract class which contains code to tag and chunk parses for bottom up parsing and leaves implementation of advancing parses and completing parses to extend class.
member.remarks: The nodes within the returned parses are shared with other parses and therefore their parent node references will not be consistent with their child node reference.

member.name: T:SharpNL.Parser.IParser
member.summary: Interface for full-syntactic parsers.

member.name: M:SharpNL.Parser.IParser.Parse(SharpNL.Parser.Parse,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the specified number of parses or fewer for the specified tokens.
member.param: A parse containing the tokens with a single parent node.
member.returns: The specified number of parses for the specified tokens.
member.remarks: The nodes within the returned parses are shared with other parses and therefore their parent node references will not be consistent with their child node reference. can be used to make the parents consistent with a particular parse, but subsequent calls to this property can invalidate the results of earlier calls.

member.name: M:SharpNL.Parser.IParser.Parse(SharpNL.Parser.Parse)
member.summary: Returns a parse for the specified parse of tokens.
member.param: The root node of a flat parse containing only tokens.
member.returns: A full parse of the specified tokens or the flat chunks of the tokens if a full parse could not be found.

member.name: T:SharpNL.Parser.TreeInsert.Parser
member.summary: Represents a built/attach parser.
member.remarks: Nodes are built when their left-most child is encountered. Subsequent children are attached as daughters. Attachment is based on node in the right-frontier of the tree. After each attachment or building, nodes are assessed as either complete or incomplete. Complete nodes are no longer eligible for daughter attachment. Complex modifiers which produce additional node levels of the same type are attached with sister-adjunction. Attachment can not take place higher in the right-frontier than an incomplete node.

member.name: F:SharpNL.Parser.TreeInsert.Parser.DONE
member.summary: Outcome used when a constituent needs an no additional parent node/building.

member.name: F:SharpNL.Parser.TreeInsert.Parser.ATTACH_SISTER
member.summary: Outcome used when a node should be attached as a sister to another node.

member.name: F:SharpNL.Parser.TreeInsert.Parser.ATTACH_DAUGHTER
member.summary: Outcome used when a node should be attached as a daughter to another node.

member.name: F:SharpNL.Parser.TreeInsert.Parser.NON_ATTACH
member.summary: Outcome used when a node should not be attached to another node.

member.name: F:SharpNL.Parser.TreeInsert.Parser.BUILT
member.summary: Label used to distinguish build nodes from non-built nodes.

member.name: T:SharpNL.Tokenize.AbstractTokenizer
member.summary: Represents an abstract tokenizer.

member.name: T:SharpNL.Tokenize.ITokenizer
member.summary: The interface for tokenizers, which segment a string into its tokens.
member.remarks:
Tokenization is a necessary step before more complex NLP tasks can be applied, these usually process text on a token level. The quality of tokenization is important because it influences the performance of high-level task applied to it.
In segmented languages like English most words are segmented by white spaces expect for punctuations, etc. which is directly attached to the word without a white space in between, it is not possible to just split at all punctuations because in abbreviations dots are a part of the token itself. A tokenizer is now responsible to split these tokens correctly.
In non-segmented languages like Chinese tokenization is more difficult since words are not segmented by a whitespace.
Tokenizers can also be used to segment already identified tokens further into more atomic parts to get a deeper understanding. This approach helps more complex task to gain insight into tokens which do not represent words like numbers, units or tokens which are part of a special notation.
For most further task it is desirable to over tokenize rather than under tokenize.

member.name: M:SharpNL.Tokenize.ITokenizer.Tokenize(System.String)
member.summary: Splits a string into its atomic parts.
member.returns: The String[] with the individual tokens as the array elements.

member.summary: Finds the boundaries of atomic parts in a string.
member.returns: The with the spans (offsets into s) for each token as the individuals array elements.

member.summary: Splits a string into its atomic parts.
member.returns: The String[] with the individual tokens as the array elements.

member.summary: Finds the boundaries of atomic parts in a string.
member.returns: The with the spans (offsets into s) for each token as the individuals array elements.

member.name: T:SharpNL.Tokenize.TokenizerME
member.summary: A Tokenizer for converting raw text into separated tokens.
member.remarks: The features are loosely based off of Jeff Reynar's UPenn thesis: Topic Segmentation: Algorithms and Applications. This tokenizer needs a statistical model to tokenize a text which reproduces the tokenization observed in the training data used to create the model. The class encapsulates the model and provides methods to create it from the binary representation.

member.name: T:SharpNL.Utility.Evaluation.FMeasure`1
member.summary: The FMeasure is an utility class for evaluators which measure precision, recall and the resulting f-measure (weighted harmonic mean).
member.typeparam: The type of the objects to be evaluated.
member.remarks: Evaluation results are the arithmetic mean of the precision scores calculated for each reference sample and the arithmetic mean of the recall scores calculated for each reference sample.

member.name: M:SharpNL.Utility.Evaluation.FMeasure`1.CountTruePositives(`0[],`0[])
member.summary: This method counts the number of objects which are equal and occur in the references and predictions arrays. Matched items are removed from the prediction list.
member.returns: The number of true positives.

member.summary: Updates the score based on the number of true positives and the number of predictions and references.

member.summary: Merge results into FMeasure metric.

member.name: M:SharpNL.Utility.Evaluation.FMeasure`1.Precision(`0[],`0[])
member.summary: Calculates the precision score for the given reference and predicted spans.
member.returns: The precision score or NaN if there are no predicted spans.

member.name: M:SharpNL.Utility.Evaluation.FMeasure`1.Recall(`0[],`0[])
member.summary: Calculates the recall score for the given reference and predicted spans.
member.returns: The recall score or NaN if there are no reference spans.

member.name: M:SharpNL.Utility.Evaluation.FMeasure`1.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string that represents the current object.
member.returns: A string that represents the current object.

member.name: P:SharpNL.Utility.Evaluation.FMeasure`1.PrecisionScore
member.summary: Retrieves the arithmetic mean of the precision scores calculated for each evaluated sample.
member.value: The arithmetic mean of all precision scores
member.remarks: In other words the precision score means the percent of selected items that are correct.

member.name: P:SharpNL.Utility.Evaluation.FMeasure`1.RecallScore
member.summary: Retrieves the arithmetic mean of the recall score calculated for each evaluated sample.
member.value: The arithmetic mean of all recall scores
member.remarks: In other words is the opposite measure of , means the percent of correct items that are selected.

member.name: P:SharpNL.Utility.Evaluation.FMeasure`1.Value
member.summary:
Retrieves the f-measure score.
f-measure = 2 * precision * recall / (precision + recall)

member.name: T:SharpNL.Utility.FeatureGen.FeatureGeneratorUtil
member.summary: This class provide common utilities for feature generation.

member.summary: Initializes static members of the class.

member.name: M:SharpNL.Utility.FeatureGen.FeatureGeneratorUtil.TokenFeature(System.String)
member.summary:
Generates a class name for the specified token. The classes are as follows where the first matching class is used:
lc - lowercase alphabetic
2d - two digits
4d - four digits
an - alpha-numeric
dd - digits and dashes
ds - digits and slashes
dc - digits and commas
dp - digits and periods
num - digits
sc - single capital letter
ac - all capital letters
ic - initial capital letter
other - other
member.returns: The class name that the specified token belongs in.

member.name: T:SharpNL.Utility.FeatureGen.GeneratorFactory
member.summary: Creates a set of feature generators based on a provided XML descriptor.
member.example:
Example of an XML descriptor:
<generators> <charngram min = "2" max = "5"/> <definition/> <cache> <window prevLength = "3" nextLength = "3"> <generators> <prevmap/> <sentence/> <tokenclass/> <tokenpattern/> </generators> </window> </cache> </generators>
member.remarks:
Each XML element is mapped to a which is responsible to process the element and create the specified . Elements can contain other elements in this case it is the responsibility of the mapped factory to process the child elements correctly. In some factories this leads to recursive calls the method.
In the example above the generators element is mapped to the which then creates all the aggregated to accomplish this it evaluates the mapping with the same mechanism and gives the child element to the corresponding factories. All created generators are added to a new instance of the which is then returned.

member.name: M:SharpNL.Utility.FeatureGen.GeneratorFactory.Create(System.IO.Stream,SharpNL.Utility.FeatureGen.FeatureGeneratorResourceProvider)
member.summary:
Creates an from an provided XML descriptor.
Usually this XML descriptor contains a set of nested feature generators which are then used to generate the features by one of the opennlp components.
member.param: The from which the descriptor is read, the stream remains open and must be closed by the caller.
The resource provider which is used to resolve resources referenced by a key in the descriptor.
member.returns: Created feature generators.

member.name: M:SharpNL.Utility.FeatureGen.GeneratorFactory.CreateGenerator(System.Xml.XmlElement,SharpNL.Utility.FeatureGen.FeatureGeneratorResourceProvider)
member.summary: Creates a for the provided element. To accomplish this it looks up the corresponding factory by the element tag name. The factory is then responsible for the creation of the generator from the element.
member.param: The resource provider which is used to resolve resources referenced by a key in the descriptor.
member.returns: IAdaptiveFeatureGenerator.

member.name: T:SharpNL.Utility.ListHeap`1
member.summary: Represents a generic heap list.
member.typeparam: The value type of this heap list.
member.remarks: This class implements the heap interface using a as the underlying data structure. This heap allows values which are equals to be inserted. The heap will return the top K values which have been added where K is specified by the size passed to the constructor. K+1 values are not gaurenteed to be kept in the heap or returned in a particular order.

Contained spans: All spans which are contained by another are removed

The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .

The current stream does not support reading, or the destination stream does not support writing.

The byte offset in at which to begin writing data from the stream.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .

The stream does not support reading.
The stream is currently in use by a previous read operation.

member.name: M:SharpNL.WordNet.SynSet.GetClosestMutuallyReachableSynset(SharpNL.WordNet.SynSet,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{SharpNL.WordNet.SynSetRelation})
member.summary: Gets the closest synset that is reachable from the current and another synset along the given relations. For example, given two synsets and the Hypernym relation, this will return the lowest synset that is a hypernym of both synsets. If the hypernym hierarchy forms a tree, this will be the lowest common ancestor.
member.returns: Closest mutually reachable synset

member.name: M:SharpNL.WordNet.SynSet.GetDepth(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{SharpNL.WordNet.SynSetRelation})
member.summary: Computes the depth of the current synset following a set of relations. Returns the minimum of all possible depths. Root nodes have a depth of zero.
member.returns: Depth of current SynSet

member.name: M:SharpNL.WordNet.SynSet.GetDepth(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{SharpNL.WordNet.SynSetRelation},System.Collections.Generic.List{SharpNL.WordNet.SynSet}@)
member.summary: Computes the depth of the current synset following a set of relations. Returns the minimum of all possible depths. Root nodes have a depth of zero.
member.param: Synsets that have already been encountered. Prevents cycles from being entered.
member.returns: Depth of current SynSet

member.name: M:SharpNL.WordNet.SynSet.GetLexicallyRelatedWords
member.summary: Gets lexically related words for the current synset. Many of the relations in WordNet are lexical instead of semantic. Whereas the latter indicate relations between entire synsets (e.g., hypernym), the former indicate relations between specific words in synsets. This method retrieves all lexical relations and the words related thereby.
member.returns: Mapping from relations to mappings from words in the current synset to related words in the related synsets

member.summary: Gets all synsets for a word, optionally restricting the returned synsets to one or more parts of speech. This method does not perform any morphological analysis to match up the given word. It does, however, replace all spaces with underscores and call String.ToLower to normalize case.

POSs to search. Cannot contain POS.None. Will search all POSs if no restriction is given.

member.returns: Most common synset for given word/pos pair
